p.a: RSU1 Meals and Backpack Program Update
Maine Department of Education Press Release
Event: Remote Board Meeting/Budget Public Forum

div.p: Please read Superintendent Patrick Manuel's April 9th Update Letter to families and community concerning the rest of the school year. https://5il.co/ewja view image

Please direct Public Comments to vferris@rsu1.org, by 12:00 noon on Monday, April 27th. Include, â€œPublic Comment,â€ in the subject line. As many comments as possible will be read at the meeting. All comments will be read by board members and included in the meeting records.
Please join us remotely for the RSU1 Board Meeting and Public Budget Forum Monday, April 27th, at 6:00PM. This can be livestreamed at https://youtu.be/hHkGa0EsJVE

RSU 1
34 Wing Farm Parkway
Bath, ME 04530
Phone: 207-443-6601

p.strong: In an effort to mitigate and slow the spread of COVID-19 and keep our students, staff, and families safe, RSU 1 will be providing remote learning to students for the rest of the 2019-20 school year.

div.p: We have chosen to do this precautionary closing to best protect the well-being of students and staff as a result of updates from Governor Mills and the Department of Education, both recommending the importance of social distancing. We will release further updates as they become available. Thank you.

As of Wednesday, March 18th, Central Office staff will be working remotely from home until further notice. Staff will be checking their email on a regular basis and accessing their voicemail messages from home.

For any general questions, please contact Veda Ferris at vferris@rsu1.org or Annmarie Harkins at aharkins@rsu1.org. For payroll questions, please contact Debra Clark at dclark@rsu1.org Special Education questions should be directed to Victoria Warner at vwarner@rsu1.org.

We will continue to stay in touch with you over the next two weeks. We understand this is a time of great uncertainty, and are here to support you and your children while at the same time doing our best to insure healthy practices for all in the community.
